Posts.Content: Jan 19, 2011 05:45PM onedayatatime wrote: Hi all, I so wish someone else was on this estrogen therapy. OR even knew someone who is, or was. OR that I had more confidence in this. I've been on estrogen, not AI's anymore, for one week today. I haven't noticed anything except 2 days ago I was dizzy, sat down and was fine, and some nausia and very tired. Fine the next day. Called the dr and she said none of that was due to estrogen, but I did see that as se's on the paper that came with the pills. I also asked if estrogen was to make it so AI's would work again and she said no. They are looking for the estrogen to shrink the tumors. If the tumors don't shrink on the estrogen, then to chemo. My cancer is lobular and I think somewhere I read years ago that chemo doesn't work too well on lobular. I don't know how true this is. Anyhow, thanks for listening. Love and Prayers, Marsha
Posts.Title: Calling All Liver Mets-Need Input dragonfly stitchyphish

Posts.Content: Jan 15, 2011 06:08PM onedayatatime wrote: On Wednesday I found out I have liver mets, 3 of them 2 inches each. I have been on AI's for bone mets for 8 years and now this including more bone mets progression. I was surprised she put me on estrogen, 3 times a day, exactly the opposite of AI. My bc is er pr pos and her 2 neg, lobular. She did say I would be on chemo if this didn't work but she really felt it would. Has anyone heard of this or had experience with it? I don't know what to make of it. Thank you so much for writing and being here eventhough it's not a fun place to be. Everyone helps me so much and you don't even know it! Love and Prayers, Marsha
Posts.Title: Calling All Liver Mets-Need Input dragonfly stitchyphish

Posts.Content: Jan 16, 2011 08:38AM onedayatatime wrote: redskies, I don't know how to thank you for giving me that website. So you and the people on that website have heard of what she is having me do. You don't know how reassuring that is to me to know this is a real treatment. You just don't know, so thank you so very much. I feel like I can take a breath. I am just days into this liver deal and on something I've never heard of. Janewit, you have so been through it with the liver, but I had no idea there was so much out there for it that has so much measure of success. Thank you so much for posting. I honestly didn't know this week if I could really hope for success.  Remember when Liver was just something you hoped you weren't having for dinner?
Posts.Title: Calling All Liver Mets-Need Input dragonfly stitchyphish

Posts.Content: May 9, 2013 01:03AM onedayatatime wrote: I was on this very treatment when numerous AIs failed and next step was chemo, but my onc wanted to try this one last thing before chemo.i was on the high dose estero dial and it did result in some regression steadily and slowly. For me the bleeding side effect was overwhelming and debilitating. Enormous clots heavy bleeding with no stopping. After a couple unsuccessful attempts with medications she had me have a uterine oblation. Not a drop of blood after that, but after another about 5months progression to liver and chemo. I'm glad we tried though, 6 months is 6 months. Love and prayers, Marsha
Posts.Title: Treating ER+ with estrogen when anti-hormonals faili? marymoir RetrieverMomNancy

Posts.Content: Oct 2, 2012 08:57PM onedayatatime wrote: Wonderful topic. Dx in '03 with Breastcancer spread to bones. Onc said I had two years. NED for the next 5years on famara. Progression in bones, then a year ago lots of tumors in liver and about all the bones. Now on navelbine. Ten years later still here. Hasn't been fun all the time but so worth every living minute. My faith in God gets me through the not fun times. I never went back to the first onc again. Love and prayers. Marsha

Posts.Title: Prognosis Kazzie61 curveball

Posts.Content: Dec 4, 2012 04:51AM onedayatatime wrote: One morning as we have done for years we went in to paneras where we meet with friends for coffee. The other day one of the men said in a loud hardy har har voice, here comes HEDDA HOPPER! Referencing the hats I've been wearing. He himself had a good laugh as did the jerk who was sitting with him. I really couldn't believe it. We've known him for a long time and his wife just died of lung cancer a few mos ago, bald. She had one baseball hat and I'm wasting brain cells trying to figure out what was bothering him about my hats, why it was any of his business, and how he could shout out something so awful in front of the whole restaurant heads turning everywhere and a good time was had by all, except me!

Got the adramycin today. Three wednesdays on, one off. White and red blood still going down some. So nervous now, but I think my pattern is to freak for about 3 days then I settle down. Very unhappy with the steroids as premed. I lost 65 pounds on xEloda now since oct I've gained 10 back. I'm trying but pounds keep creeping up. Love and prayers, marsha
Posts.Title: adriamycin - working or not? stadown stadown

Posts.Content: Mar 20, 2013 12:34AM onedayatatime wrote: I've been on adriamycin since oct. no scans yet but liver nos. are normal from 854 to 122. Normal is 25 to 125. Due to very low white count onc decreased the chemo by 25 per cent. Scared me to death but she said id be sicker with too low white counts. SEs have not been bad at all with this chemo. Even before she reduced the chemo my hair started to come back a little. Not in a committed sort of way. Just fuzzy. Ok, so I'm not going to freak about the chemo not working bec hair is starting to show up. Thank you so much for for taking away one more stressor from my vast selection of real and imagined horrors! Love and prayers, marsha
Posts.Title: adriamycin - working or not? stadown stadown

Posts.Content: Dec 8, 2010 02:41AM onedayatatime wrote: This is such a good idea. My original dx in '03 was stage IV, mets to bones. Femara for 5 years NED, then things started jumping around, Faslodex, more bone mets then in Feb '10 total hip replacement and reconstruction to bones around there, then Tamoxifin, stable bone scan in July. Tumor markers jumped by 19 from 52-71 in Nov so she will do bone and ct scans Jan 11. I feel fine, swim everyday so I can't imagine it could be too bad. So, so far, only hormonals. It would be great to keep it that way. All is in God's capable hands!
Posts.Title: WANTED: STAGE IV FIVE YEAR SURVIVORS! MCTHO eag1954

Posts.Content: Jan 12, 2011 08:30PM onedayatatime wrote: I just posted this on another thread, but thought this was a good place too. As of TODAY I am a liver lady. I've had bone mets for 8 years and on aromatase inhibitors that whole time, now today she took me off the AI's and put me ON estrogen when scan showed 3 things in the liver 2 inches in size each. I haven't heard anyone doing that, has anyone here? She seemed pretty confident and said in a month we'll see what the blood says. Today tumor markers were 99, up 20 from two mos ago. This is a very scary turn of events. Love and Prayers, Marsha

Posts.Content: Jul 1, 2012 12:04AM onedayatatime wrote: Thank you so much for you answer. Ifeel so much better. That's where I was in the middle of the night. Used fan ice bags ice and didn't have to Go to er. So happy. Hope and pray for the best for you. Marsha
Posts.Title: For those on navelbine LuAnnH onedayatatime

Posts.Content: Jul 27, 2012 08:41PM onedayatatime wrote: I so admire all of you so much, training for bike, working and sounding so positive. I am a weenie of the highest order! I've been doing navelbine for a couple months and this time the hemoglobin dropped to 8.8. That was Wednesday and I was feeling even more tired last night and my daughter took it again at her office and it was 8.4. So I'm thinking it is dropping fast, called dr today left message. She seemed so long in calling back we just headed to the er an hour away, then nurse finally called aft talking to the dr and said wait till mon and see how it is. As soon as I heard shortness of breath came with low numbers I immediately felt like panting like a dog in the sun. Navelbine seems to be working some. Liver enzymes went from 800 something to 198. Scans in 2 weeks to really see. Thank you all for being here and so wonderful. God bless you.
Posts.Title: For those on navelbine LuAnnH onedayatatime

Posts.Content: Jun 14, 2013 12:29AM onedayatatime wrote: If you type in Pseudocirrhosis Breast Cancer then poke around. What I can understand is very interesting and important. When chemo is successful, we keep on using it until we've used a lot, which causes this condition. I THINK! Anyhow, we'll see how it shakes out. Did I mention I loved getting chemo today! Thank you for all the hope you've given me. I hate to think of doing this but I think you are right. If this stuff becomes helpless a second opinion I will definitely try. When I talked to my sister in ca yesterday and told her what I knew then she booked a ticket for here to arrive sat. I couldn't believe it. She said it wasn't bec I was going to die. She just loves to come here. Well I hope that is true. Love and prayers. Marsha

Looks like news about out come is pretty much the same but they did give half again dose of adrimicin, so that to me was good. Bilirubin went up from 2 to 3.1.very scared in just in two weeks. She did give me extra estrogen which worked some. I look at all the chemos out there and just wonder why they can't even one won't break through the scar tissue. Thank all of you wonderful ladies for your support while you are suffering too. Love and prayers, Marsha
Posts.Title: out of options onedayatatime NickyJ

Posts.Content: Jun 29, 2012 07:55PM onedayatatime wrote: Hi there. I started out on xEloda and got so sick they changed me to navelbine which seems to be working. No scans yet just blood. Anyhow like most of you no appetite lost 52 pounds. Some fatigue not so bad though. If I'd put the book down at night I'd sleep and be fine the next day. One thing no one has mentioned is fever. Every single day I have a fever from 99.0 to 102.7. I'm on 50mgs 2 on 1 off. They say go to er if it gets to 100.4. I just can't do that anymore. It is hours and hours there and they don't seem to know the problem. Chest X-rays urine sample blood cultures and nothing. Does anyone else have trouble with fevers on navelbine? Thanks for listening and God bless you. Marsha. btw stage 4 in 03. Bones and now liver.
Posts.Title: For those on navelbine LuAnnH onedayatatime

Posts.Content: Jul 21, 2012 09:24AM onedayatatime wrote: Well aft my drs apt I think I'm to understand the fever is not from the navelbine but the liver as the tumors change from the navelbine. Now she said dont go to the er and gave me prescription for naproxen which I think is like ibuprophen. I am already on Celebrex and pharmacist said I can't take both. Navelbine was Wed. and fever is almost 102 now but coming down aft the naproxen. Very confusing. Anyhow, navelbine seems to be working as liver numbers went from high 800's at the beginning 2 months ago to 198 on Wed. I do have to think navelbine has got to be responsible at least in part for the fever. God bless you. Marsha

Posts.Title: out of options onedayatatime NickyJ

Posts.Content: Apr 3, 2011 11:48PM onedayatatime wrote: How about estrogen for liver mets, ER, PR strongly positive bc! I've been through multiple antihormonals with continuous progression for the last 3 years of my 9 year fight with stage IV. When cancer spread to the liver, dr wanted to try this one last thing before chemo to see if the cancer could be tricked WITH estrogen. After 2 mos ct scan showed stable with even maybe a tiny shrinkage in tumors throughout the liver and TMs from 100 to 85. First drop in years. I take extrogen pills 3 times a day and it is pretty tolerable except for bleeding (I'm 60), heavy at times. They are watching it I think that if it is working I'll have a hysterectomy. Sounds nuts. We'll see.
Posts.Title: Any one with liver mets on hormone treatment only? Suebus barsco1963

Posts.Content: Jul 22, 2013 11:36PM - edited Jul 22, 2013 11:37PM by onedayatatimedaughter It is with great sadness that I am writing to tell you my mother, Marsha Kane, onedayatatime, passed away on Tuesday, July 16, at 9:37 a.m. On July 5 Mom was extremely fatigued and when she got out of bed was too weak to even stand and walk to the bathroom. We called 911 and went to our local emergency room who was in direct communication with mom's oncologist in Indianapolis, who was miraculously on call for the weekend. We took an ambulance to the IU Simon Cancer Center where Mom was under her oncologist's direct care. Ultimately the liver was failing - after 10 years it could not take any more. On July 6 the doctor told Mom she would be going home to hospice. We left the hospital on July 7. Mom was surrounded by family and friends for the 10 days we had at home, and remained strong and independent until the end. I know all the ladies I am writing to here meant so much to my Mom. You gave her strength. You were a refuge, a place she shared fears she did not share with us. She would tell me about how strong and positive everyone was. She loved reading the posts, especially in the middle of the night - you kept her company. Thank you for being there for my mom. Keep fighting! We all have an extra angel looking out for us now! Shannon Kane, onedayatatimedaughter.
Posts.Title: out of options onedayatatime NickyJ

Posts.Content: Jun 13, 2013 10:36PM onedayatatime wrote: To all you wonderful, blessed ladies, I went to onc today to find out about the liver scan, armed with two pages of questions and info from all of you. My daughter got here early and went over every single thing and wrote it all down. And then we left for Indy. The first thing dr did was hold my hands in both of hers and said "the news about the lliver is generally good. All tumors smaller. The thing is that I have pseudo cirrocis. A rare condition that creates scar tissue from the dead tumors from the chemo being successful. The chemo was over aggressive in my case thus, (thus?! I never say thus) producing more scars and causing more side effects. So she put me on half the adryamicin and every 2 weeks. I can't beileve this happened. SHe thinks it might work. It sounds far from "out of options" but she did say we could be back in the same place in two weeks. Thank you so much for you info, and caring. Love and prayers. Marsha I'm not sure i understand all this but but I did get chemo today: )
Posts.Title: out of options onedayatatime NickyJ

Posts.Content: Mar 5, 2013 02:51AM onedayatatime wrote: Has anyone heard of BORAX for mouth sores from chemo. I have been on adriomicin for almost a year and only just now getting the mouth sores and they hit hard. None of the usual remidies worked. I have a friend who is a nurse and she told me to try this borax. Three tiny pills under the tongue. I'm telling you I think it's working. I'm very surprised and want to say it is something else, like my week off. I haven't told my onc which is probably dumb so I have no idea what she would think. Hmmm, get rid of mouth sores and remove stains from your clothes in one fell swoop. Don't know what I think of all that! Love and prayers, marsha
